paramInformation.label: Dimming Speed (Z-Wave)
paramInformation.description: How fast or slow the light turns on when you hold the switch (e.g., dimming from 10-20%, 80-60%, etc.). 0 = Instant On, 1 = 1 second, 100 = 100 seconds. NOTE IF USING A DUMB SWITCH: This parameter will not work when pressing the dumb switch manually.

paramInformation.label: Dimming Speed (Manual)
paramInformation.description: How fast or slow the light turns dim when you adjust the switch remotely (e.g., dimming from 10-20%, 80-60%, etc.). 0 =  Instant On, 1 = 1 second, 100 = 100 seconds, 101 = Keep in sync with Parameter 1.

paramInformation.label: Ramp Rate (Z-Wave)
paramInformation.description: How fast or slow the light turns on when you press the switch 1x to bring from On to Off or Off to On. 0 = Instant On, 1 = 1 second, 100 = 100 seconds, 101 = Keep in sync with Parameter 1.

paramInformation.label: Ramp Rate (Manual)
paramInformation.description: How fast or slow the light turns on when you bring your switch from On to Off or Off to On remotely. 0 = Instant On, 1 = 1 second, 100 = 100 seconds, 101 = Keep in sync with Parameter 1.

paramInformation.label: Minimum Dim Level
paramInformation.description: Minimum level the light switch will dim to (great for fixing flickering bulbs). 1 = 1%, 2 = 2%, 45 = 45%.

paramInformation.label: Maximum Dim Level
paramInformation.description: Maximum level the light switch will dim to. 55 = 55%, 56 = 56%, 99 = 99% (NOTE: Z-Wave only goes up to 99%, not 100%).

paramInformation.label: Invert Switch
paramInformation.description: Inverts the switch (Tap Down = On, Tap Up = Off).

paramInformation.label: Auto Off Timer
paramInformation.description: Automatically turns the switch off after x amount of seconds. 0 = Disabled, 1 = 1 second, 32767 = 32767 seconds.

paramInformation.label: Default Level
paramInformation.description: Default dim level for the switch when pressed locally (at the switch) 0 = Switch will return to level it was prior to being off, 1 = 1%, 99 = 99% (NOTE: Z-Wave only goes up to 99%, not 100%).

paramInformation.label: Default Level (Z-Wave)
paramInformation.description: Default dim level for the switch when powered on via a Z-Wave command. 0 = Switch will return to level it was prior to being off, 1 = 1%, 99 = 99% (NOTE: Z-Wave only goes up to 99%, not 100%) .

paramInformation.label: Power On State
paramInformation.description: When power is restored, the switch reverts to either On, Off, or Last Level. 0 = Off, 1-99 = Specific % On, 101 = Returns to Level before Power Outage.

paramInformation.label: Power On State
paramInformation.description: When power is restored, the switch reverts to either On, Off, or Last Level. 0 = Off, 1-99 = Specific % On, 101 = Returns to Level before Power Outage.

paramInformation.label: LED Bar Color
paramInformation.description: This will set the default color of the LED Bar. Calculated by using a scaled hue color circle (realHue / 360 * 255).

paramInformation.label: LED Bar Brightness
paramInformation.description: This will set the intensity of the LED bar (i.e., how bright it is). 0 = Off, 1 = Low, 5 = Medium, 10 = High.

paramInformation.label: LED Bar Brightness When Off
paramInformation.description: This is the intensity of the LED bar when the switch is off. 0 = Off, 1 = Low, 5 = Medium, 10 = High.

paramInformation.label: LED Bar Effect Color
paramInformation.description: This will allow you to add some sweet effects to your LED bar (e.g., pulse, chase, solid, etc.). This is Byte 1 (of 4): Choose color using the scaled hue color circle (realHue / 360 * 255).

paramInformation.label: LED Bar Effect Brightness
paramInformation.description: This will allow you to add some sweet effects to your LED bar (e.g., pulse, chase, solid, etc.). This is Byte 2 (of 4): LED Bar Brightness Level.

paramInformation.label: LED Bar Effect Duration
paramInformation.description: This will allow you to add some sweet effects to your LED bar (e.g., pulse, chase, solid, etc.). This is Byte 3 (of 4): Bar Duration. 0 = disabled, 1 to 60 = seconds, 61 to 120 = minutes (minus 60), 121 - 254 = hours (minus 120), 255 = indefinitely.

paramInformation.label: LED Bar Effect Type
paramInformation.description: This will allow you to add some sweet effects to your LED bar (e.g., pulse, chase, solid, etc.). This is Byte 4 (of 4): Bar Effect Type.

paramInformation.label: LED Bar Indicator Timeout
paramInformation.description: Changes the amount of time the RGB Bar shows the Dim level if the LED Bar has been disabled. 0 = Always off, 1 = 1 second after level is adjusted, 10 = 10 seconds after level is adjusted.

paramInformation.label: Active Power Reports
paramInformation.description: The power level change that will result in a new power report being sent (% of previous report). 0 = Disabled, 10 = 10% of previous report, 100 = 100% of previous report.

paramInformation.label: Periodic Power & Energy Reports
paramInformation.description: Time period between consecutive power and energy reports being sent (in seconds). 0 = 0 seconds, 1 = 1 second, 32767 = 32767 seconds. Timer resets after every report is sent.

paramInformation.label: Energy Reports
paramInformation.description: The energy level change that will result in a new energy report being sent (kWh difference from previous report). 0 = 0.01 kWh, 10 = 0.1 kWh, 100 = 1 kWh difference from previous report.

paramInformation.label: Energy Reports
paramInformation.description: The energy level change that will result in a new energy report being sent (% of previous report). 0 = Disabled, 10 = 10% Of previous report, 100 = 100% Of previous report.

paramInformation.label: AC Power Type
paramInformation.description: Sets whether the switch is wired with or without a neutral wire.

paramInformation.label: Switch Type
paramInformation.description: Sets installation type.

paramInformation.label: Physical Button Delay Period
paramInformation.description: Adjust the delay when parameter 51 is enabled. 1=100ms, 2=200ms, 3=300ms, etc.

paramInformation.label: Button Delay and Scene Control
paramInformation.description: Disabling this allows the switch to respond instantly to physical actions. Note: Disabling the delay also disables scene control except for Button 1 (i.e., tap up 1x or tap down 1x) and button 7 (config button). All other buttons (2-6) will be disabled.

paramInformation.label: Smart Bulb Mode
paramInformation.description: Change the working mode of the dimmer. Choose either On/Off-Only mode which makes the device work like an on/off switch, or choose Smart Bulb mode which optimizes the device for interaction with smart bulbs.

paramInformation.label: Smart Bulb Mode
paramInformation.description: Put the switch into 'Smart Bulb' mode. If it set to 1, the power will output maximum % when the dimmer is on. 0 = Normal Operation, 1 = Smart Bulb.

paramInformation.label: Smart Bulb Mode
paramInformation.description: Optimize power output to be more compatible with smart bulbs. This prevents the dimmer from being able to dim & makes it act like an ON / OFF switch.
